path: TITLE XI: DELEGATION OF POWER AND COMMITTEE PROCEDURE >> Article 73: Exercise of the delegation >> Section 5
text: Section 5

path: TITLE XI: DELEGATION OF POWER AND COMMITTEE PROCEDURE >> Article 73: Exercise of the delegation >> Section 5
text: Any delegated act adopted pursuant to Article 4, Article 7(1) , Article 11(3) , Article 43(5) and (6) and Article 48(5) shall enter into force only if no objection has been expressed by either the European Parliament or the Council within a period of three months of notification of that act to the European Parliament and the Council or if, before the expiry of that period, the European Parliament and the Council have both informed the Commission that they will not object. That period shall be extended by three months at the initiative of the European Parliament or of the Council.

path: TITLE XI: DELEGATION OF POWER AND COMMITTEE PROCEDURE >> Article 74: Committee procedure
text: Article 74: Committee procedure

path: TITLE XI: DELEGATION OF POWER AND COMMITTEE PROCEDURE >> Article 74: Committee procedure >> Section 1
text: Section 1

path: TITLE XI: DELEGATION OF POWER AND COMMITTEE PROCEDURE >> Article 74: Committee procedure >> Section 1
text: The Commission shall be assisted by a committee. That committee shall be a committee within the meaning of Regulation (EU) No 182/2011.

path: TITLE XI: DELEGATION OF POWER AND COMMITTEE PROCEDURE >> Article 74: Committee procedure >> Section 2
text: Section 2

path: TITLE XI: DELEGATION OF POWER AND COMMITTEE PROCEDURE >> Article 74: Committee procedure >> Section 2
text: Where reference is made to this paragraph, Article 5 of Regulation (EU) No 182/2011 shall apply.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS
text: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS

text: Article 75: Amendment to Regulation (EC) No 300/2008

text: Section 1

text: In Article 4(3) of Regulation (EC) No 300/2008, the following subparagraph is added:

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 75: Amendment to Regulation (EC) No 300/2008 >> Section 1
text: “When adopting detailed measures related to technical specifications and procedures for approval and use of security equipment concerning Artificial Intelligence systems in the meaning of Regulation (EU) YYY/XX [on Artificial Intelligence] of the European Parliament and of the Council*, the requirements set out in Chapter 2, Title III of that Regulation shall be taken into account.”

text: Section 1

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 82: Amendment to Regulation (EU) 2019/2144
text: Article 82: Amendment to Regulation (EU) 2019/2144

text: Section 1

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 82: Amendment to Regulation (EU) 2019/2144 >> Section 1
text: In Article 11 of Regulation (EU) 2019/2144, the following paragraph is added:

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 82: Amendment to Regulation (EU) 2019/2144 >> Section 1
text: “3. When adopting the implementing acts pursuant to paragraph 2, concerning artificial intelligence systems which are safety components in the meaning of Regulation (EU) YYY/XX [on Artificial Intelligence] of the European Parliament and of the Council*, the requirements set out in Title III, Chapter 2 of that Regulation shall be taken into account.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 83: AI systems already placed on the market or put into service
text: Article 83: AI systems already placed on the market or put into service

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 83: AI systems already placed on the market or put into service >> Section 1
text: Section 1

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 83: AI systems already placed on the market or put into service >> Section 1
text: This Regulation shall not apply to the AI systems which are components of the large-scale IT systems established by the legal acts listed in Annex IX that have been placed on the market or put into service before [12 months after the date of application of this Regulation referred to in Article 85(2) ], unless the replacement or amendment of those legal acts leads to a significant change in the design or intended purpose of the AI system or AI systems concerned.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 83: AI systems already placed on the market or put into service >> Section 1
text: The requirements laid down in this Regulation shall be taken into account, where applicable, in the evaluation of each large-scale IT systems established by the legal acts listed in Annex IX to be undertaken as provided for in those respective acts.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 83: AI systems already placed on the market or put into service >> Section 2
text: Section 2

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 83: AI systems already placed on the market or put into service >> Section 2
text: This Regulation shall apply to the high-risk AI systems, other than the ones referred to in paragraph 1, that have been placed on the market or put into service before [date of application of this Regulation referred to in Article 85(2) ], only if, from that date, those systems are subject to significant changes in their design or intended purpose.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review
text: Article 84: Evaluation and review

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 1
text: Section 1

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 1
text: The Commission shall assess the need for amendment of the list in Annex III once a year following the entry into force of this Regulation.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 2
text: Section 2

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 2
text: By [three years after the date of application of this Regulation referred to in Article 85(2) ] and every four years thereafter, the Commission shall submit a report on the evaluation and review of this Regulation to the European Parliament and to the Council. The reports shall be made public.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 3
text: Section 3

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 3
text: The reports referred to in paragraph 2 shall devote specific attention to the following: (a) the status of the financial and human resources of the national competent authorities in order to effectively perform the tasks assigned to them under this Regulation; (b) the state of penalties, and notably administrative fines as referred to in Article 71(1) , applied by Member States to infringements of the provisions of this Regulation.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 4
text: Section 4

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 4
text: Within [three years after the date of application of this Regulation referred to in Article 85(2) ] and every four years thereafter, the Commission shall evaluate the impact and effectiveness of codes of conduct to foster the application of the requirements set out in Title III, Chapter 2 and possibly other additional requirements for AI systems other than high-risk AI systems.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 5
text: Section 5

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 5
text: For the purpose of paragraphs 1 to 4 the Board, the Member States and national competent authorities shall provide the Commission with information on its request.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 6
text: Section 6

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 6
text: In carrying out the evaluations and reviews referred to in paragraphs 1 to 4 the Commission shall take into account the positions and findings of the Board, of the European Parliament, of the Council, and of other relevant bodies or sources.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 7
text: Section 7

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 84: Evaluation and review >> Section 7
text: The Commission shall, if necessary, submit appropriate proposals to amend this Regulation, in particular taking into account developments in technology and in the light of the state of progress in the information society.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 85: Entry into force and application
text: Article 85: Entry into force and application

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 85: Entry into force and application >> Section 1
text: Section 1

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 85: Entry into force and application >> Section 1
text: This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union.

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 85: Entry into force and application >> Section 2
text: Section 2

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 85: Entry into force and application >> Section 2
text: This Regulation shall apply from [24 months following the entering into force of the Regulation].

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 85: Entry into force and application >> Section 3
text: Section 3

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 85: Entry into force and application >> Section 3
text: By way of derogation from paragraph 2: (a) Title III, Chapter 4 and Title VI shall apply from [three months following the entry into force of this Regulation]; (b) Article 71 shall apply from [twelve months following the entry into force of this Regulation].

path: TITLE XII: FINAL PROVISIONS >> Article 85: Entry into force and application >> Section 3
text: This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
